name: Laluna Hotel and Resort

reviews.text: We really liked our 4 night stay at Laluna! The buildings were attractive, very clean and well-maintained. The tropical garden setting was simply beautiful. We have a lovely, spacious room and bathroom. The breakfasts were great and the laundry service excellent. The restaurant food was more expensive than street food but that was to be expected however overall we consider this hotel to be great value for money. The hotel was a short distance from the main town centre but we enjoyed the local way of travel in tuk-tuks and songthaews. Unfortuantely we didn't have time to use the swimming pool but it did look very inviting.The staff at the reception desk and in the restaurant were attentive and friendly and looked after us so very well. We highly recommend this hotel and would like to stay there again.
reviews.title: Impeccable Hotel/Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It was very nice and had a lovely pool area and good facilities.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in Chiang Rai

reviews.text: Our room was quite roomy and the bathroom was the biggest bathroom I have ever used in a hotel.
reviews.title: Location seems strange, but good hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think this hotel is quite new so is in very good condition and not dated at all.
reviews.title: Good hotel with the need of a renovation

reviews.text: They have a pretty good selection of foods available for breakfast and we had dinner in the hotel twice. The food was very nice and the service very good.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, indifferent service

reviews.text: We only spent one rainy night in La Luna, so this review can only really be counted as a first impression. The hotel is a bit outside the center of Chiang Rai but easy to get to by tuktuk or taxi.
reviews.title: nice hotel though a bit fussy

reviews.text: The rooms were beautiful and well equipped - including working wifi - and set in beautiful gardens. Peaceful. Breakfast was fine.
reviews.title: Large rooms, garden setting, decent breakfast

reviews.text: On our short visit, we found staff rather fussy than genuinly friendly and we were very surprised at the high prices charged at reception for a taxi to the airport. We were also surprised that the management went back to check the room at check-out. A beautiful place but lacking a bit in warmth.
reviews.title: Can't really fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About 15 minutes walk from the Night Market, this secluded resort is set in beautiful landscaped gardens. The bungalows are large and well-appointed, though the adjoining walls are rather thin, and we could hear the neighbours' tv clearly from our bed. There is also sporadic laughter and shouting on the pathway that passes the garden bungalows, which is why they are a little cheaper, I suspect.
reviews.title: Individual bungalows in a tranquil setting.

reviews.text: Reception staff were friendly and helpful, and the buffet breakfast offered plenty of choice. The restaurant could be improved if staff were trained to collect plates promptly and not to pick their noses while lounging beside the dirty dishes trolley. Overall, this hotel was clean and well-managed, but the wait-staff in the restaurant did not impress any of us and, in fact, we lost our appetites rather quickly due to the sloppy service and unhygenic habits of the staff.
reviews.title: Beautiful place

reviews.text: Staff are all young and need a supervisor and lesson in customer relations. Rooms are large but bed is not positioned along head board and nowhere near reading lamp. Room with 2 singles more expensive than room with 1 queen.
reviews.title: over rated no bar service when thai soaps start. Breakfast poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at Laluna and found it to be a nice relaxing hotel. Rooms were of a good size and very clean,comfy huge bed.No extras in the room (tea, coffee, etc.), but wasn't to concerned. Booked a tour from here with Raeny inside the reception area, was a great guide for the next day. Swimming Pool is huge and the lush gardens make it very tropical, great way to end your day. Breakfast was a large variety and of a good standard. Staff were helpful, but give the pushbikes a miss as they were in need of some repairs. Hire them from town as it is cheaper and in better condition. The Bakery near the Bus terminal hires them and the bakery supports street kids.The only drawback with this Hotel is its 25 to 30 minutes walkj from town.
reviews.title: Great Garden and Swimming Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Superior Bungalow - Garden - King room. It was in a beautful garden setting. A very quiet place to stay. The rooms were a very good size and the shower in the bathroom was huge. Very comfortable bed. It is a little way out of town so either get a tuk tuk or it would be about a 25 min walk. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included. Good selection and in a nice setting as well. Pleasant stay. The pool area was lovely but we did not use it as it was a little too cool for us to swim. Would recommend this as a good place to spend in Chian Rai.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in beautiful garden setting

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights @ Laluna Hotel and had mixed feelings about many different aspects of this Hotel. From the begining. Drove in through the very impressive enterance to the reception area. This looks very promissing. Reception staff were very polite and proffessional. Had booked a poolside room and a fair walk through the hotel gardens to gain access to the room. The gardens and lay-out of the Hotel are very well appointed, I'm thinking this is a 4 Star aspect. Shown into my room which was very spacious, very well appointed, tidy and spotlessly clean with 1 of the biggest beds I have seen. Wall mounted flat screen TV and a bigger than normal fridge. Table and chairs near the window that look out to the pool which is very adequate in size - in fact big. Arrived about lunchtime and headed straight to the Hotel Restuarant. Meal was priced as you would expect from a Resort Hotel. Chicken Snitzle and French Fries in the 350 baht range. It was huge and I could only eat half. It was of a high standard. Again 4 Star quality. All downhill from here other than the bed on the first night. It was comfortable. However, I require good aircon and its location within the room wasn't quite right. I ended up the first night, swinging the pillow around and sleeping at the foot of the bed just to feel cool & comfortable. The aircon was very noisy and you could hear the thermostat kicking in and out all night. Woke up in the morning and I always have to have a coffee fix starter. Water into the jug provided by the Hotel, but hello........ no coffee ot even tea bags. Nothing. Just a jug and 2 cups provided. Whats the point.???? Bring your own !!!!!! No i didn't. So I will shower and go to the free buffet breakfast provided within the price and try and get my overdose of coffee there. The Shower - Had to wait about 10 minutes before any hot water arrived. I was finished by that time. Quickly to the breakfast area and poured 2 cups of coffee before I eat. Bummer !!!!!!! The coffee was the worst coffee I have ever - in my life - tried to drink. I couldn't. Had to get a cup of tea, at least the Liptons was palatable. Oh please Laluna, you have to do something about that coffee. Nothing in the room and you cannot drink what's at the Buffet Breakfast. 0/10 for the lack of a good brew first thing in the morning. Now the breakfast. Just the typical bay maree style of half raw fried eggs or rubber like scrambled eggs. Huge selection of all other products that cater for a variety of nationalities. No better but not worse than many other hotels I have stayed at. 1 evening I sat at the Cocktail lounge and enjoyed the hospitality of the staff there and had quite a few laughs whilst enjoying the Happy Hour ( 3 hours ) of buy 1 get 1 free. Would I stay there again.?? It is worthy to consider another stay, but you learn from the experience that you have to be better prepared with your own supply of coffee. Value for money ? acceptable because of the special price on offer when I booked. Would have rated this hotel 100% except for the fact of the lack of coffee supplied in the room or at the buffet breakfast. Come on Laluna, it doesn't cost much to lift your game in this area. Hotel rating for me = 75%. If this has helped you decide on Laluna Hotel, please give me a tick of approval.
reviews.title: 4 Star - 3 Star - 2 Star - 1 Star .... All in 1 Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in December. Rooms are nice, clean and spacious. The service was friendly and the pool looked great though we didn't have time to try it out. Breakfast was so so...
reviews.title: Nice simple resort in Chiang Rai

reviews.text: The rooms are dark and noisy - every bungalow is on the way to everywhere else.
reviews.title: Nice Gardens. Everything else sucks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have to keep the curtains shut for basic privacy.
reviews.title: it was ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is mosquito infested and the staff open all the windows during cleaning to air out the dank air which lets in more mosquitos.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: The restaurant breakfast is free which is about what it's worth with little variety, bouncy scrambled eggs, urn coffee, and cold croissants straight out of a supermarket plastic package.
reviews.title: A Unplanned Stop - but very nice

reviews.text: Worst is the restaurant/room service which is insultingly expensive and serves microwaved meal packages of zero culinary value and exorbitant price. They charge 50 Baht for water at the table (the usual glass bottle) and 50 Baht for half a cup of white rice as a side dish.
reviews.title: Could be much better but let themselves down with the little things.

description: Laluna Hotel & Resort serves you with the 79 modern Thai style houses that are fully equipped with international standard amenities. When you stay at Laluna Hotel & Resort you will feel like staying at your home. A warm and friendly family management will make your stay in Chiangrai more memorable. With its neatly selected facilities, Laluna Hotel & Resort will ensure that you will get the utmost in comfort and privacy during your stay.
